topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Creating and Deleting Routers

body.p: A network connects to the router through an interface.

You can:
create a router
delete a router
body.section:
Create a routerYou must create an interface between the network and router to remotely connect to the network and any instances on that network through the router.
When you create a new router, the router does not have any internal interface and it is not associated to any subnet. You can optionally specify an external gateway after creating the router.
Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.
Based on whether you are working on a project or the domain:
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Routers tab.
Click the Project dashboard, then the Network panel, then the Routers tab.
The available router(s) appear.
Click Create Router.
On the Create Router tab enter a name for the network.
Click Create Router.

section.title: Deleting a router
section.p: You must remove all router interfaces before deleting the router, by removing all internal interfaces.

ol.li: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.

Based on whether you are working on a project or the domain:
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Routers tab.
Click the Project dashboard, then the Network panel, then the Routers tab.
The available router(s) appear.
Determine if the router is connected to a network using the Network Topology screen:

Click the Routers link on the Project dashboard Network panel.
The routers for the selected project appear.
If the router is connected to a network:
Click the name of the router you want to delete.
On the Router Details screen, select the interface(s) for the router and click Delete Interface.
Return to the Routers screen.
For the router you want to delete, click Edit Router then Delete Router
In the confirmation window, click Delete Router.
